title: Russian 'pick-up artist' accused of secretly filming women in Ghana
content: Ghana has called on Russia to extradite the man, who is accused of recording sexual encounters without consent.

title: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
content: Giving some newborns in Guinea-Bissau an established hepatitis B treatment but not others is "unethical", it says.

originalTitle: Eleven killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, rescuers say

originalTitle: Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using dart frog toxin, UK says
title: A Story About Mr. Alexei and a Mysterious Sickness
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends across Africa! It’s your friendly news reporter, here to share a story about something that happened far, far away, in a big country called Russia. It’s important to learn about what happens in our big world, just like we learn about our own villages and towns. Today, we are talking about a man named Mr. Alexei Navalny. He was an important person in Russia. He had big ideas about how to make his country a better place for everyone. Sometimes, when people have big ideas, they like to share them and talk about them. Mr. Alexei was like that – he loved to talk about his ideas and hoped they would help his country grow.

Who Was Mr. Alexei?

Imagine you have a group of friends, and you all have different ideas about how to play a game. Some of you might want to play football, and others might want to play hide-and-seek. Mr. Alexei was a bit like someone who had different ideas for his country than the people in charge. He wanted to make sure things were fair for everyone. He wanted people to be happy and safe. He talked a lot about these things, and many people listened to him. He was known for being very brave and speaking his mind, even if it was sometimes difficult. He wanted the leaders of Russia to listen to ordinary people. He believed that everyone's voice was important. Think of it like when you share your ideas in class – you want the teacher to hear you, right? Mr. Alexei wanted the leaders to hear the people of Russia.

What Happened to Mr. Alexei?

One day, something very sad happened to Mr. Alexei. He became very, very sick. It was not like a normal cold or a tummy ache. It was a very serious sickness that made him feel very unwell. He was so sick that he had to go to the hospital. When someone gets very sick, doctors try their best to find out why. They look at clues and try to understand what happened. Mr. Alexei's doctors worked hard to help him. They tried to make him feel better and find out what made him so ill. Sadly, even with all the doctors' help, Mr. Alexei passed away. This means he went to sleep forever. It was a very sad day for many people who knew him and believed in his ideas.

The Mysterious Substance

Now, here's where the story gets a bit like a mystery. When Mr. Alexei was very sick, scientists and doctors looked very, very carefully at tiny parts from his body. They were looking for clues, like detectives in a storybook. They found something strange. They found a special kind of very strong substance. This substance is like a powerful, hidden thing that can make people very sick if it gets into their body. It's not something you would ever touch or play with. This strong substance is called a 'toxin'. Some toxins are found in nature. For example, some animals have toxins to protect themselves. This toxin was very special and very powerful. Did you know? There are some very beautiful, brightly coloured frogs in nature called 'dart frogs'. They are tiny, but their skin has a strong toxin that can be dangerous if touched! They use it to protect themselves from other animals. But humans don't use these for good things.

What Did Other Countries Say?

After Mr. Alexei passed away, another country, called the United Kingdom (or the UK for short), looked at all the information. The UK is a big country far away, across the ocean. Its leaders and clever people looked at the facts and clues. The UK said something very important. They said that finding this special, strong toxin in Mr. Alexei's body was not an accident. They believed that someone put it there on purpose to hurt him. They said there was no simple, innocent reason for it to be there. It's like if you found a special kind of paint on someone's toy that you know is only used in one place. If that toy wasn't supposed to be in that place, it means someone put it there, right? The UK leaders thought it was like that – the toxin shouldn't have been in Mr. Alexei's body by accident.

Why Does This Matter to Us?

You might be thinking, "Why is a story from far-off Russia important to me, here in Africa?" Well, my young friends, it's important because we all live on one big planet, and we are all part of one big human family. When something bad happens to someone far away, it reminds us that we all need to be kind and fair to each other. It reminds us that people should be safe, no matter where they live or what ideas they have. Did you know? Just like a big tree needs strong roots and branches to grow, a country needs its people to be safe and free to share their ideas to grow strong and fair. When people are afraid to speak up, it can make things difficult for everyone. This story is a reminder that we should always hope for a world where people can share their thoughts and ideas safely, without anyone trying to hurt them. It's about hoping for a world where everyone is treated fairly and kindly, just like we try to be with our friends and family. Let's always remember to be kind, to speak up for what is right, and to wish for peace and safety for everyone, everywhere. Thank you for listening to this important story, my little news heroes!
summary: Mr. Alexei Navalny, a brave man from Russia with many ideas, became very sick and passed away, and another country, the UK, believes a special harmful substance was used against him on purpose.
whyMatters: This story matters because it teaches us about safety, fairness, and how important it is for everyone to be able to share their ideas without fear, no matter where they live in our big world.

originalTitle: Pereira announced as Forest boss on 18-month deal
title: Pereira announced as Forest boss on 18-month deal
content: Nottingham Forest appoint Vitor Pereira on an 18-month deal as the 57-year-old becomes the club's fourth manager of the campaign.
